title: [Large-scale] Community-based Research Design Workshop for Preventing Adolescent Alcohol Abuse

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic social science research methodologies, lack of experience in community education projects
context.additional_context: A competency-building program for pre-service teachers, utilizing a mobile-optimized LMS. Experiencing co-production-style research design for solving community issues

learning_goals: Learners develop a three-stage framework (problem diagnosis–data collection–solution strategy proposal) analyzing causes, impacts, and solutions to alcohol abuse in the community according to youth participatory research design methodology and achieve at least 80% suitability through peer evaluation and advisor review.

Learners can apply a community-based production process (co-design, feedback loops, role distribution) to research, select one local community issue with 5–10 adolescents, establish collaborative problem-solving strategies (action plan, role distribution chart, evaluation criteria) over 8 weeks, and submit a prototype outcome.
Writing team-based research proposals in a mobile LMS environment and incorporating peer feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
